entry.title: Re: üá©üá™ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core
entry.content: Hey everyone! I just send an email that we increased the quota and now have 44 seats available üôÇ See all of you on Friday!

entry.title: üîµ Harness Generative AI Integration using SAP Cloud SDK for AI
entry.content:
In this session, we'll explore how to integrate Generative AI capabilities into your projects using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI, leveraging the SAP AI Core infrastructure. We'll cover key orchestration features like templating, content filtering and simplified LLM access, and as well as LLM access using the industry-standard framework LangChain.

Speaker: Deeksha Sinha, SAP

Validation tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2024-week4-ai-session-validation.html

entry.title: Re: üá©üá™ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core
entry.content: I sent an email a couple of days ago but if you signed up yesterday or the day before you might have not gotten it. I will trigger it again üôÇ But as we have 44 seats and 41 signed up, you are welcome to come on Friday!

entry.title: üîµ Choosing the Right LLM for your Use Case: Accuracy, Cost, and Performance in the Balance
entry.content:
With the ever-growing list of large language models (LLMs) available in Generative AI Hub, selecting the best one for specific use cases can be a daunting task. This talk delves into our process of evaluating LLMs for running our use-case, Joule on the SAP Design System, focusing on three critical metrics: accuracy in answering questions, response speed, and query cost. Through this talk, we'll explore how we need to balance the needs of expert users and community members while addressing the demand for rapid, cost-effective, and accurate responses.

Speaker: Joerg Goeppert and Hee Tatt Ooi, SAP

entry.title: üîµ Innovating with SAP's Generative AI Hub and Azure OpenAI‚Äã
entry.content:
Join Holger Bruchelt (Microsoft), Rene Pajta (Microsoft) and Tanvi Agrawal (SAP) to learn about Microsoft's and SAP's AI partnership and hear about SAP's AI internal enablement leveraging LLMs from Azure OpenAI and other partners. Stay tuned until the end to hear from SAP developers and their experience with generative AI during the internal Global GenAI Learn & Hack Days!

Validation tutorial: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2024-week4-ai-session-validation.html

entry.title: üá´üá∑ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and Python. You do not need to have any background in the topic, but a lot of curiosity!

In this CodeJam you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use text chunks and embeddings to improve your RAG response.

This is a free in-person event and is planned for Tuesday, February 4th in Strasbourg, France üá´üá∑ from 9:00 to 15:00 CET (GMT+01:00). The language of the event and the content will be in English. The instructor is the Developer Advocate Nora von Thenen.

The event is being hosted at:

Nagarro France 

8a Rue Icare, 67960 Entzheim

The event is kindly being hosted by Nagarro, thank you! Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees. 

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Visit the SAP CodeJam group for more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees.

entry.title: Understand the World of AI with SAP Learning
entry.content:
Are you also still confused by all the hype around artificial intelligence (AI) and what it is all about?

Are you struggling with where to start and how all those new topics fit into the SAP ecosystem?

Even many AI skeptics, whom I talk to, are now forced to improve their workflows and systems using AI. But not all problems can be or should be solved by generative AI. For many problems we can still rely on smaller machine learning models. On the SAP Learning site, you can find a lot of very good learning content on classical machine learning (ML), AI, and generative AI to make your way through this AI jungle. 

Let me highlight some of the key resources there that can help you get started. 

Exploring the world of AI 

The first course is called Exploring the world of AI where you will get a good understanding of AI and Machine Learning with helpful hands-on examples. If you are a gamer you will enjoy the examples ‚Äì I promise! You will also learn about different learning techniques such as supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning, and you get a basic understanding of neural networks.  

On a side note: a special type of neural network architecture called a transformer is the foundation for large language models (LLMs). The most famous example of an LLM is the model behind ChatGPT. 

‚ÄùExploring the World of AI: An agent that learns‚Äù 

Generative AI at SAP 

If you are new to the topic of AI, you should check out the second course called Generative AI at SAP. I have observed that a lot of people either overestimate generative AI and think current LLMs will solve all our problems, or they underestimate LLMs because of a couple of wrong responses they received when chatting with a model. If you want to successfully incorporate AI into your business processes, it is important to understand what LLMs are capable of and where their downfalls are. This course will certainly clear up some of the question marks you might have. 

‚ÄúGenerative AI at SAP: Introduction to generative AI‚Äù 

Exploring the SAP Business AI Portfolio 

The free, self-paced learning journey Exploring the SAP Business AI Portfolio is the third resource I can highly recommend. Throughout my travels I have met a lot of people with different roles in the SAP ecosystem and one question I almost always face is: ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between Joule and Generative AI Hub?‚Äú 

The short answer is: Joule is our AI assistant, embedded in our portfolio and Generative AI Hub is part of our AI solution portfolio (AI Foundation) and gives you a set of tools to build your own generative AI use cases. Whenever Joule or any other generative AI use case at SAP sends a request to an LLM it goes through Generative AI Hub because that is the easiest and safest way to use LLMs in the SAP landscape. This learning journey will give you a better understanding of what SAP offers in AI. 

AI Foundation as part of SAP Business Technology Platform 

Putting AI Ethics into Practice at SAP 

My last recommendation here is the learning journey Putting AI Ethics into Practice at SAP. At SAP the trust of our partners and customers is of utmost importance. This learning journey focuses on how we at SAP are embedding AI into our portfolio by always ensuring our solutions are relevant, reliable, and responsible. This learning journey covers everything about SAP‚Äôs Global AI Ethics Framework, our guiding principles for AI ethics and our AI ethics assessment process.  

‚ÄúPutting AI Ethics into Practice at SAP: Introducing the Main Concepts‚Äù 

Additional Developer Content 

If you are a developer and you are looking for hands-on material, more technical explanations and example code, then you should stop by our SAP Developers YouTube channel! Here you can find live streams, video tutorials, an SAP AI playlist and all the sessions of Devtoberfest. For real in-person hands-on sessions, check out the free upcoming SAP CodeJam events near you or host your own SAP CodeJam. You pick the topic; we provide the expert and the system. You can pick between a variety of topics, including three ML and AI CodeJams on machine learning on SAP HANA, generative AI and CAP, and Generative AI Hub and Python. 

Let me know what YOU struggle with when it comes to AI and especially AI at SAP! We will do our best to answer your questions and point you to the right learning materials. Also, I‚Äôd love to know which of the four learning resources you enjoyed the most and what your biggest learning was. My highlight was to refresh my knowledge on reinforcement learning with the practical examples given in the course Exploring the world of AI. 

I look forward to hearing from you! 

Also check out our new genAI certification: SAP Certified Associate - SAP Generative AI Developer

entry.title: üá≥üá± Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core
entry.content:
**** THIS EVENT IS NOW FULLY BOOKED. REGISTRATION IS CLOSED ****

This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and Python. You do not need to have any background in the topic, but a lot of curiosity!

In this CodeJam you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use text chunks and embeddings to improve your RAG response.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Friday February 14th, 2025 at the INNOV8iON offices in Utrecht, Netherlands üá≥üá± from 13:00 - 19:00 local time. The language of the event and the content will be English. 

The instructor will be Developer Advocate @noravonthenen.

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 35 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: SAP Developer Challenge March - SAP Community Escape House - AI ü§ñüß†
entry.content:
The second SAP Developer Challenge of the year is now available! The Developer Advocates have created the SAP Community Escape House - a virtual escape house (consisting of multiple rooms) that you can play in your browser. Read on for all the details.

SAP Developer Challenges are all about having fun, trying new things, and learning along the way. You can also earn a badge in the SAP Community upon successful completion. For this year, all SAP Developer Challenges will happen in the SAP Community Escape House. For each challenge, we will unlock a new room in the house, and they all have a specific focus topic. Completing a challenge means successfully escaping the room by solving a series of coding-related tasks/questions. This month is all about AI, specifically the generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and the SAP HANA Cloud vector engine.

The details of January's challenge (UI5) are here: link.
The details of February's challenge (Integration) are here: link.

 

How to participate

Visit the SAP Community Escape House and enter your numeric SAP Community user ID. If you don't know your user ID, go to your SAP Community profile. You can find the numeric ID at the end of the URL.

SAP Community Escape House - Enter your SAP Community ID


Once you see the SAP Community Escape House, select the AI room and start exploring it.

SAP Community Escape House - Available rooms

The user interface of an escape room includes the room itself as well as a terminal. You can click the objects in the room to receive tips. Like in a real (physical) escape room, you will have to try out a few things and explore the room until you receive helpful tips and, eventually, instructions. These tips and instructions are printed in the terminal next to the room. The terminal is also used to submit solutions to tasks. Read the instructions you receive carefully to understand how.

SAP Community Escape House - AI room

If you successfully escape the room (you will know when that happens), you will receive a badge in the SAP Community. We will assign the badges once the challenge closes.

The schedule

The AI room was unlocked on March 3rd and the challenge closes on March 31st, so you will have to escape the room until then to qualify for a badge. We will also inactivate all the service keys you need to access Generative AI Hub by the end of the challenge. The room will stay unlocked until the end of the year so you can still try it out with your own system. Unlike the previous year, this SAP Developer Challenge does not consist of weekly sub-challenges. The next room (next challenge) will be unlocked in April.

Good luck and happy escaping!

entry.title: üá©üá™ Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and Python. You do not need to have any background in the topic, but a lot of curiosity!

In this CodeJam you will learn how to use Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core to implement a retrieval augmented generation (RAG) use case to improve the responses of large language models (LLMs) and reduce hallucinations. You will learn how to deploy an LLM and the orchestration service on SAP AI Core and query it via SAP AI Launchpad and the Python SDK. Furthermore, you will learn about the most important genAI concepts and create and use embeddings to improve your RAG response and build your own chatbot with memory.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Monday April 28th, 2025 at the SAP AppHaus (HDL02) in Heidelberg, Germany üá©üá™ from 09:00 - 15:00 local time. The language of the event and the content will be English. 

The instructor will be Developer Advocate @noravonthenen.

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, etc.

Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: üá©üá™ Build AI services using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and Generative AI Hub
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Build AI services using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAP AI Core and Generative AI Hub. It is beneficial if you have some basic knowledge about JavaScript as we're using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI with the JavaScript variant.

This CodeJam introduces attendees to aspects of exposing generative artificial intelligence (genAI) capabilities to execute tasks using a given business context.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with the theory behind genAI, SAP AI Core, SAP AI Launchpad, and learn how to use the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model to expose AI capabilities through your own OData service.

While working through the exercises, you'll become comfortable creating CDS-based service definitions and integrating them into the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and SAP AI Core Foundation Models.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Friday September 26th, 2025 in Hamburg, Germany üá©üá™ from 09:30 am - 03:30 pm. The workshop site will be the SAP office in Hamburg. The event will be held in english.

The instructor is the Developer Advocate @nicoschoenteich.

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome.

Please note that seating is limited - we can only accomodate 25 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.
